intro: Sarcomphalus sarcomphalus, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white or greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in some areas.
